required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of Heat Generation From Low Speed Drilling Without Irrigation
clinical_study.official_title: ASSESSEMENT OF LOW SPEED DRILLING WITHOUT IRRIGATION VERSUS CONVENTIONEL DRILLING WITH IRRIGATION REGARDING HEAT GENERATION AND PERI-IMPLANT MARGINAL BONE LOSS

brief_summary.textblock: ASSESSMENT OF LOW SPEED DRILLING WITHOUT IRRIGATION VERSUS CONVENTIONAL DRILLING WITH IRRIGATION REGARDING HEAT GENERATION AND PERI-IMPLANT MARGINAL BONE LOSS

detailed_description.textblock: Assessment of heat generation from conventional drilling speed for dental implant placement versus biological drilling (low speed without irrigation ) by thermocouples technology And measure the primary stability of dental implants placed by the two techniques by osstel device

primary_outcome.measure: Measurement of heat generation from low speed hand piece drills drilling by thermocouple technology
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of 3 different depths(mms). Data analyzed with a three-way analysis of variance by Newman-Keulsmultiple comparison procedure. The significance level was set to a p-value of 0.05.

secondary_outcome.measure: stability-osstell device to assess the primary stability of placed dental implant
secondary_outcome.description: Resonance frequency analysis (RFA) allows assess implant stability by measuring implant oscillation frequency on the bone

intervention.description: comparing between conventional implant placement drilling speed with irrigation and experimental arm (low speed without irrigation)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: both sex no intraoral soft and hard tissue pathology no systemic condition that contraindicate implant placement adult patients with proper posterior mandibular ridge requires implant placement
Exclusion Criteria:
presence of pathological lesions heavy smokers more than 20 cigarettes per day patients with systemic disease that may affect normal healing Patients with no enough bone in posterior mandible for implant placement
